G.L. c. 208.proposition: Plaintiff will present and rely on applicable Massachusetts SJC and Appeals Court opinions at hearing addressing these principles (statements of principles appear, for example, in Massachusetts appellate decisions construing G.L. c. 208 and applying the best-interests standard to modification requests), as well as any controlling precedent specifically addressing modification where the primary grounds for the original custody allocation (such as parental schooling, housing, or employment constraints) have changed.
